subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0093_01C9D561.05704E80
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I do see where you could have gotten that.

  ----- Original Message ----- =

  From: Frank Sumption 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, May=
 15, 2009 1:04 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you ge=
t





  I know, it just sounded like "this is what's really there..."



 =
 On Fri, May 15, 2009 at 11:11 AM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombieghos=
tresearch.com> wrote:





    Here's the thing though - if you put somethi=
ng out there, and ask people to listen to it, your inviting opinions. Some =
will be in agreement, and some won't, no matter what.

    If EVP messages =
are for the one that recorded them, then it shouldn't surprise you, or offe=
nd you, if someone doesn't hear the same thing you do. If you don't want co=
ntrary opinions on something, then you should not give people the chance to=
 critique.

    Now I could see if someone flat out said your recordings we=
re all trash, period. You would have every right to be angry, but noone is =
saying that, at least I am not saying that.

    I just stated that I did n=
ot hear what James heard, and though I wasn't going to say he doesn't have =
anything, I can't say that he does either.

      ----- Original Message --=
--- 
      From: Frank Sumption 
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
      S=
ent: Friday, May 15, 2009 11:00 AM
      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what yo=
u hear is what you get



      Yeah, and we've all heard the thing about o=
pinions.

       F-s


      On Fri, May 15, 2009 at 10:53 AM, April Abercr=
ombie <april@...> wrote:





        Noone is say=
ing what they hear is law, just their opinion.

          ----- Original Me=
ssage ----- 
          From: Frank Sumption 
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogro=
ups.com 
          Sent: Friday, May 15, 2009 10:43 AM
          Subject: R=
e: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get



           Soooo, everyon=
e hears different, and personally I find it offensive when someone presumes=
 to tell everyone what another researhcer's voices really say. I think EVP =
messages are for the one that recorded thmm, to everyone else it's non-sens=
e, except there's enough to show that there is a phenomenon. 

           I=
 get really tired of these self proclaimed experts trying to dicate what's =
acceptable.

           Frank-S


          On Fri, May 15, 2009 at 10:04 A=
M, Rick <rasterer@...> wrote:




            I opened your folder an=
d examined all your files.

            Here are my opinions (I have trunca=
ted the file names due to laziness):

            ahh_mmm noises, no speech=

            call_us noises, no speech
            cal_us (enhanced) severa=
l listenings: pixelated, no speech
            compare_panasonic noises, no=
 speech
            compare_sony noises, no speech
            first_epv no=
ises, no speech
            good_whistle noises, no speech (maybe feedback)=

            hey_can noises, no speech
            hey_whats noises, no spe=
ech
            I_hit noises, no speech
            important_date noises, =
no speech
            keep_moving several listenings: Hellalal see woobeh 
=
            laugh_evp noises, no speech
            lets_wait several liste=
nings: noises, no speech
            maybe_gun noises, no speech
          =
  miss_you noises, no speech
            my_question several listenings: no=
 da lee
            oh_ noises, no speech
            something several lis=
tenings: noises, no speech
            that_mans noises, no speech
        =
    that's_jim noises, no speech
            this_one several listenings: n=
oises, no speech
            tomorrow noises, no speech

            The on=
es that took several listenings I thought I might hear words in, so I exami=
ned those several times. Sometimes I could sort of hear something that sort=
 of sounded like what you suggested, but I could also hear it in other ways=
, or not at all.

            So my suggestion to you, if you want to get l=
ess subjective conjuctures or simply less affirmations of your own interpre=
tations, is to post the future ones without labels. The labels you give can=
 influence the listeners: when you have a sound that could be several thing=
s, and you note that it sounded like "keep it moving", the listener can fin=
d it nearly impossible to try NOT to hear what you heard, and so not be abl=
e to give a fresh perspecive to help your research methods. 



           =
 --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "James W. Hyslope" <clockdryve@...> wrote:=

            >
            > Go to my Folder in the files section "Jim's RR=
-DR60 EVP's" and see if anyone (needs to) decide "FOR ME" and let me know i=
f I am of the serious type. In my short time I have gathered enough "proof"=
 for myself that this method works for ME. And from what I have seen from o=
thers that I have let "listen" to my files (friends) I am blessed with the =
"ability" to HEAR very low audio artifacts....so this will help me in my RE=
SEARCH. And I am OPEN to any help to reach my goals (or help others) with t=
heir goals. Have fun people. On a HAPPIER NOTE :) I was lucky enough to cat=
ch the RR-DR60 taking a nap yesterday....it missed a few evp's real close t=
ogether (in a 5 second clip) the Sony ICD-B7 heard a male use a different n=
umber than what I used. I said 16 (my earlier age I was saying in recorder)=
 and the male evp said 13....then a female laughs. All this was missed by t=
he DR60 (except my 16 was recorded in both recorders) BUT then the DR60 "ca=
ught" the B7 "napping" at near the end of the 5 second clip....the DR60 hea=
rd "let me out" in a clear (quite) males voice. So this is very promising p=
iece of evidence for me. **those 2 recordings have been uploaded to my fold=
er. I will include an Olympus W-10 (soon as arrives), Panasonic RR-US360 (w=
hen I think to grab it) and my RR-QR80 to go with my RR-QR100, and one more=
 (can't remember what brand-model of this last---due to arrive) LOL. I need=
 to build a multiple mounting devise to aid in putting these into tandem se=
rvice. Then I think I will use my Olympus DS-50 as my "Control" recorder...=
.by using it on the HQ settings. I am looking to build a "subsonic" microph=
one also (something to do with those low "booms" that I have noticed lead o=
r follow many evp's). So I look forward to any ideas. Falure is NOT an opti=
on. Haha.....
            >
